survey.res: YOU CANNOT SELECT 'NONE' AND ALSO MAKE A SELECTION.
YOU MUST MAKE A SELECTION OR SELECT 'NONE'.
PLEASE BACK UP AND ENTER THE LETTER/NUMBER COMBINATION THAT YOU INTENDED TO ENTER.
THIS IS NOT THE CORRECT STIMULI. PLEASE SEE YOUR SUPERVISOR.
YOU MUST SELECT AT LEAST ONE PRODUCT FOR PURCHASE
PLEASE INFORM THE INTERVIEWER THE STIMULI IS NOT CORRECT FOR THIS VERSION.

block.label: Logistics

autofill.label: JobNumber
autofill.title: AH226 - Kleenex Occasion Enabling Hub PackFlash 360

title.b: Set True or False based on Self Administered or Interviewer led. This drives text later. REMEMBER, no need to update text later as it should match exactly in word document.

checkbox.label: S_Recruit_Incentive
checkbox.title: INTERVIEWER: Indicate if the respondent is any of the following:

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Please select your location:

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

autofill.label: Months
autofill.title: Enter number of months here 1,3,6,12 for past purchased, BUMO

block.html:
INSTRUCTIONS:
For the start of interview all interviewers must wear gloves and masks at all times.
Must have hand sanitizers available at each station for staff & respondents.
All respondents should be asked to wear gloves and a mask/facial covering. If the respondent does not have their own, please provide.
All hand cards & shopping cards should be in sheet protectors and wiped down after each respondent.
The use of any equipment (ET clicker & chair, tablets, keyboard, stylus, desks, etc.) must be sanitized before and/or after each respondent.
ET clicker can be covered in plastic and/or wiped down after each use.
Keep staff a safe distance of 6 ft. away from respondents at all times.
For Live Shelf & Printed Shelf displays, instruct respondent to point at products during the shopping exercise –
NO TOUCHING OF THE PRODUCTS OR PRINTS.
For Digital Shelf displays, have respondents use stylus pen –
NO TOUCHING OF THE SCREEN.
For ShopperLab Studies, have respondents apply a post-it to the products purchased and have them write the number of purchases on the post-it. Ensure that pens are cleaned before handling and discard all unused post-its that were handled by the respondent.

Good morning/afternoon/evening. I am ________ from Behaviorally, an international research organization. We are conducting research on various products and value your opinion. Could you spare some time to answer some questions?

html.label: Intro_Recruit
html.b:
HELLO AND WELCOME TO OUR SURVEY!
THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION. THIS STUDY IS VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND WE ASK THAT YOU ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY.
WHILE GOING THROUGH THE SURVEY, PLEASE USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS AND IMAGES. PLEASE REMEMBER THAT THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS. WE ARE ONLY INTERESTED IN YOUR OPINIONS.
THANK YOU AGAIN! LET’S BEGIN…

div.ul:
Must have hand sanitizers available at each station for staff & respondents
All hand cards & shopping cards should be in sheet protectors and wiped down after each respondent.
The use of any equipment (Chair, tablets, keyboard, stylus, desks, etc.) must be sanitized before and/or after each respondent.

survey.html:
Hello, we are from a local market research firm looking to conduct a survey. We are interested in your opinions.
If you qualify, we would like to ask you to participate in a survey at our facility. We have taken all the measures necessary to sanitize our location.

radio.label: Q1R
radio.title: Are you or any of your other household members currently experiencing any cold or flu-like symptoms (cough, runny nose, fever, etc.) or do you or any of your other household members have or had COVID-19 in the past month?

radio.label: Q2R
radio.title: Have you recently been in close contact with anyone experiencing any cold or flu-like symptoms (cough, runny nose, fever, etc.) or anyone who has or had COVID-19 in the past month?

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past 2 weeks, on any of the following topics?
checkbox.comment: Read list. Select all that apply.

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or does anyone in your immediate family work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.comment: Read List. Select all that apply.
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or public relations firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Chocolate products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Hair Care products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Facial Tissue products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

radio.label: S_GroceryShop
radio.title: How much of the household’s grocery shopping do you, yourself, do?

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

radio.label: S_Gender2
radio.title: Do you identify as transgender?
radio.row: I do not wish to disclose

number.label: S_Age
number.title: Please type in your age below.

select.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY
select.title: Which of the following best describes you?
select.choice: Black or African American, or Black British

checkbox.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY2
checkbox.title: Please select all of the following that describe you.
checkbox.row: Black or African American, or Black British

select.label: STANDARD_INCOME
select.title: Please select the range that best represents your total annual household income.

radio.label: S_Child
radio.title: Do you have any children under the age of 18 currently living in your home?

checkbox.label: S_ChildAge
checkbox.title: How old are the children currently living in your home?
checkbox.comment: Read List. Select all that apply.

radio.label: Q1
radio.title: When was the last time you bought facial tissue?
radio.row: More than 1 year ago but in the past 3 years

radio.label: Q2
radio.title: Would you expect to purchase facial tissue in the future?

select.label: Q3
select.title: How often do you buy facial tissues per year?

radio.label: Q4
radio.title: What is the format you typically buy?

select.label: Q5
select.title: How many cartons do you purchase at a time? (i.e. a bundle of 3 cartons would be 3)

block.label: TSUM
block.builder:title: SEL point calculation
block.exec:
Q1R1=0 Q1R2=0 Q1R3=0 Q1R4=0
if(Q1.r1): Q1R1=1 if(Q1.r2): Q1R2=2 if(Q1.r3): Q1R3=3 if(Q1.r4): Q1R4=4
Total1=Q1R1+Q1R2+Q1R3+Q1R4
print Total1
Q2R1=0 Q2R2=0
if Q2.r1: Q2R1=1 if Q2.r2: Q2R2=0
print Q2R1 print Q2R2
Total2=Q2R1+Q2R2
print Total2
Q3R1=0 Q3R2=0 Q3R3=0 Q3R4=0 Q3R5=0 Q3R6=0 Q3R7=0 Q3R8=0 Q3R9=0 Q3R10=0 Q3R11=0 Q3R12=0 Q3R13=0 Q3R14=0 Q3R15=0 Q3R16=0 Q3R17=0 Q3R18=0 Q3R19=0 Q3R20=0 Q3R21=0 Q3R22=0 Q3R23=0 Q3R24=0 Q3R25=0
if(Q3.ch1): Q3R1=1 if(Q3.ch2): Q3R2=2 if(Q3.ch3): Q3R3=3 if(Q3.ch4): Q3R4=4 if(Q3.ch5): Q3R5=5 if(Q3.ch6): Q3R6=6 if(Q3.ch7): Q3R7=7 if(Q3.ch8): Q3R8=8 if(Q3.ch9): Q3R9=9 if(Q3.ch10): Q3R10=10 if(Q3.ch11): Q3R11=11 if(Q3.ch12): Q3R12=12 if(Q3.ch13): Q3R13=13 if(Q3.ch14): Q3R14=14 if(Q3.ch15): Q3R15=15 if(Q3.ch16): Q3R16=16 if(Q3.ch17): Q3R17=17 if(Q3.ch18): Q3R18=18 if(Q3.ch19): Q3R19=19 if(Q3.ch20): Q3R20=20 if(Q3.ch21): Q3R21=21 if(Q3.ch22): Q3R22=22 if(Q3.ch23): Q3R23=23 if(Q3.ch24): Q3R24=24 if(Q3.ch25): Q3R25=25
print Q3R1 print Q3R2 print Q3R3 print Q3R4 print Q3R5 print Q3R6 print Q3R7 print Q3R8 print Q3R9 print Q3R10 print Q3R11 print Q3R12 print Q3R13 print Q3R14 print Q3R15 print Q3R16 print Q3R17 print Q3R18 print Q3R19 print Q3R20 print Q3R21 print Q3R22 print Q3R23 print Q3R24 print Q3R25
Total3=Q3R1+Q3R2+Q3R3+Q3R4+Q3R5+Q3R6+Q3R7+Q3R8+Q3R9+Q3R10+Q3R11+Q3R12+Q3R13+Q3R14+Q3R15+Q3R16+Q3R17+Q3R18+Q3R19+Q3R20+Q3R21+Q3R22+Q3R23+Q3R24+Q3R25
print Total3
Q4R1=0 Q4R2=0
if Q4.r1: Q4R1=150 if Q4.r2: Q4R2=75
print Q4R1 print Q4R2
Total4=Q4R1+Q4R2
print Total4
Q5R1=0 Q5R2=0 Q5R3=0 Q5R4=0 Q5R5=0 Q5R6=0 Q5R7=0 Q5R8=0 Q5R9=0 Q5R10=0 Q5R11=0 Q5R12=0
if(Q5.ch1): Q5R1=1 if(Q5.ch2): Q5R2=2 if(Q5.ch3): Q5R3=3 if(Q5.ch4): Q5R4=4 if(Q5.ch5): Q5R5=5 if(Q5.ch6): Q5R6=6 if(Q5.ch7): Q5R7=7 if(Q5.ch8): Q5R8=8 if(Q5.ch9): Q5R9=9 if(Q5.ch10): Q5R10=10 if(Q5.ch11): Q5R11=11 if(Q5.ch12): Q5R12=12
print Q5R1 print Q5R2 print Q5R3 print Q5R4 print Q5R5 print Q5R6 print Q5R7 print Q5R8 print Q5R9 print Q5R10 print Q5R11 print Q5R12
Total5=Q5R1+Q5R2+Q5R3+Q5R4+Q5R5+Q5R6+Q5R7+Q5R8+Q5R9+Q5R10+Q5R11+Q5R12
print Total5 final=0
if(Total1>2 and Total2==1): final=-1 if(Total1>2 and Total2==0): final=-2 if(Total1==2): final=0 if(Total1==1): final=Total3*Total4*Total5
if final==-2: DV_BR_SEL.val = 0 if final==-1: DV_BR_SEL.val = 1 if final==0: DV_BR_SEL.val = 2 if(final ge 1 and final le 1499): DV_BR_SEL.val = 3 if(final ge 1500 and final le 2999): DV_BR_SEL.val = 4 if final ge 3000: DV_BR_SEL.val = 5

radio.label: DV_BR_SEL
radio.title: Hidden question to capture SEL based on responses to Q1 – Q5.

comment.span: This will be hidden after launch.

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: How often have you purchased products in each of the following categories?

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter1] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter2] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r2.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r2.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r2.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r2.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r2.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r2.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r2.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqTest
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Categoryfre] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased2
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of Facial Tissues have you purchased in the past 6 months?
checkbox.comment: Read List. Select all that apply.

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of Facial Tissues have you purchased most often in the past 6 months?

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

checkbox.label: S_Store
checkbox.title: Please indicate where you purchase facial tissue products.
checkbox.comment: Read List. Select all that apply.

radio.label: Q_NonRejecter
radio.title: Would you be open to purchasing Facial tissues in the future?

block.label: MET
block.builder:title: MET Section
block.html: During the interview you will be asked to wear a set of non-prescription eyeglasses. This is a new technology that we would like you to help us utilize. Is this OK?

radio.label: S_MET1
radio.title: Which of the following do you ever wear in order to shop in a grocery store or supermarket whether to walk down the aisles or to read package information?

radio.label: S_MET2
radio.title: DO you have issues seeing objects from 4 feet away?

radio.label: S_MET3
radio.title: Do you have any eyesight problems such as current or reoccurring eye injuries, colorblindness, a glass eye, pink eye, astigmatism, or a strabismus of any kind such as crossed eyes or lazy eye?

radio.label: S_MET4
radio.title: Do you currently use a wheelchair, motorized scooter, walker, or any other type of walking assistance device to get around on while shopping?

radio.label: S_MET5
radio.title: Are you allergic to rubber?

row.label: r1
row.autofill: not(S_MET1.r1 or S_MET2.r1 or S_MET3.r1 or S_MET4.r1 or S_MET5.r1)

radio.label: S_MET6
radio.title: ADD TO KEY IDENTIFIER SECTION. Please indicate if respondent will complete the MET exercise:
radio.validate: if S_MET6.r2: error("ALL ATLANTA RESPONDENTS MUST QUALIFY FOR MET - ANSWER 1")

html.label: Quotadisplay
html.b: HERE ARE THE QUOTAS THAT HAVE BEEN DETERMINED BY THE SCREENER:
html.div:
Gender: [pipe: Gender]
Age: [pipe: Age]
Usage P6M: [pipe: Usage]
BUMO: [pipe: BUMO]
Sample: [pipe: DV_BR_SEL]
html.b: PLEASE CHOOSE THE FOLLOWING BASED ON YOUR QUOTA NEEDS:

radio.label: Sample
radio.exec: if DV_BR_SEL.r4: Sample.val = 0 if DV_BR_SEL.r5 or DV_BR_SEL.r6: Sample.val = 1 if DV_BR_SEL.r3: Sample.val = 2

html.label: VersionCheck
html.b: THE PHASE AND VERSION ASSIGNED TO THIS RESPONDENT ARE:

number.label: Resp
number.title: Respondent ID

row.label: r1
row.strong: Kleenex Ultra On the Go Facial Tissues Pocket Packs

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.html: INTERVIEWER: At this point, hand the tablet over to the respondent. They MUST read the confidentiality agreement on the next screen and electronically sign, themselves, before being eligible to participate in the study.

p.ol: In exchange for receiving an incentive for participating in the Research (as defined below), which I hereby acknowledge, and understanding that I am otherwise under no other obligation to participate in this Research, I give my consent to Behaviorally, an independent market research company, and its affiliates and/or business partners to videotape, photograph, and/or record my participation in this consumer research and agree as follows:

title.ol:
Confidentiality: I agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
Photo/Video Release & Use: I understand that as described above certain portions of the research may be audio and/or videotaped. Any recordings in which I appear and other information I provide (e.g., text, video, images or audio) (“Research Data”) may be used by Researcher for, trade presentations, product innovation, and internal training as determined by the Researcher, and I grant to Researcher and its affiliates permission to use that information in such ways.
Intellectual Property: I agree that the Research Data may or may not be used in whole or in part and I assign to Researcher and its affiliates all ideas, developments, discoveries, works of authorship, designs, software, and/or inventions, whether or not patentable, conceived by me as a result of my participation in the research, and understand that Researcher may use them in any manner it sees fit.
Data Privacy: I understand that my personal information, if any is collected, will be used for research purposes only or as otherwise described in this Informed Consent. Researcher is the controller of such data and will take all reasonable steps to ensure my personal data is protected. I will not be identified by name in any publication regarding the research. If I am a resident of the EU, I also have the right to access the personal data Researcher holds about me and, if such personal information is inaccurate or incomplete, to request the rectification, erasure or blocking of such personal data. I understand that I can exercise my data protection rights, which may include accessing, correcting, erasing, or holding processing of personal data, or withdrawing consent to use my personal data, by contacting info@behaviorally.com.
Contagious Disease: You agree that you will follow all appropriate protocols to ensure your safety. To that end, you agree to respect all the social distancing, face covering and other local and State safety, protective and reporting orders and rules in the areas and facility. You acknowledge that in consideration for Behaviorally's decision to permit you to engage in activities on behalf of the Company, you accept the inherent risk of exposure to communicable and contagious diseases such as COVID-19, and acknowledge anyone may carry and spread the virus whether symptomatic or not. By participating, you voluntarily assume the risk that you may be exposed to or infected by such virus or disease and release Behaviorally from all liability for any injury, illness, disability, death, damage, loss, or claim related to or arising out of the COVID-19 virus, provided that Behaviorally does not recklessly or knowingly expose you to the COVID-19 virus.
Limitation of Liability: RESEARCHER EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND AS TO ANY PRODUCTS OR EQUIPMENT USED IN THIS RESEARCH, EXCEPT WHERE PROHIBITED BY LAW. IN NO EVENT WILL RESEARCHER BE LIABLE TO ME FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY OR CONSEQUENTIAL, DAMAGES, OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER, WHETHER IN AN ACTION UNDER CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, OR ANY OTHER THEORY, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE RESEARCH.

comment.span: I have read the above, and I have had the opportunity to ask questions about this study and those have been answered to my satisfaction. I voluntarily agree to be a participant and I consent to Researcher processing my personal information in accordance with this document. I have received a copy of this consent and understand I can withdraw from the study at any time.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

text.label: RecruiterName
text.title: Recruiter: Please enter your name below.

block.html:
Close out the screener on your tablet and bring the respondent to the next station.
 
Use the respondent number below to re-open this link on other devices.
Respondent Number: [pipe: Resp]
If needed, tap here to start a new blank screener for a new respondent.

text.label: Main_Interviewer
text.title: Main Interviewer: Please enter your name below.

block.label: OnlyScreenerAndRealEye1

text.label: Resp_Info
text.title: INTERVIEWER: BE SURE TO FILL IN THE RESPONDENTS CONTACT INFORMATION. THIS INFORMATION WILL BE NEEDED TO COMPLETE THE VALIDATION SHEET

title.b: PLEASE RESCREEN USING THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION. IF THIS INFORMATION IS NOT CORRECT PLEASE SEE YOUR SUPERVISOR BEFORE CONTINUING.
title.div:
Resp ID: [pipe: Resp]
Name: ${Resp_Info.Name}
Phase: [pipe: Phase]
Gender: [pipe: Gender]
Age: [pipe: Age]
Usage: [pipe: Usage]
BUMO: [pipe: BUMO]
Sample: [pipe: Sample]
MET (ATL Only): [pipe: S_METQual]
title.b:
Phone Number: ${Resp_Info.Phone}
If you have tested the telephone number and successfully rescreened this respondent, please enter your initials:

block.html:
Now bring the respondent to the next station.
 Use the respondent number below to re-open this link on other devices.
Respondent Number: [pipe: Resp]
If needed, tap here to bring up a new respondent for rescreening.

block.label: ET
block.builder:title: Eye Tracking
block.html:
ET Information
Your Respondent ID is: [pipe: Resp]
Your Sequence File name is: [pipe: JobNumber upper]Phase[pipe: Phase]

title.b: INTERVIEWER: PLEASE ENTER THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:

block.note: Only use this MET_Resp_Display block if there is MET

div.ul:
BRING RESPONDENT TO CALIBRATION AREA
COMPLETE THE MET CALIBRATION
ON THE NEXT SCREEN, HOLD THE TABLET UP TO THE RESPONDENT FOR 3 SEC. WHILE IT DISPLAYS THE RESPONDENT NUMBER

text.label: Shopping_Interviewer
text.title: Shopping Interviewer: Please enter your name below.

block.label: Shopping

b.ul:
Keep a safe distance of 6 ft. away from respondents at all times
For Live Shelf & Printed Shelf displays, instruct respondent to point at products during the shopping exercise – NO TOUCHING OF THE PRODUCTS OR PRINTS
For Digital Shelf displays, have respondents use stylus pen – NO TOUCHING OF THE SCREEN
For ShopperLab Studies, have respondents apply a post-it to the products purchased and have them write the number of purchases on the post-it. Ensure that pens are cleaned before handling and discard all unused post-its that were handled by the respondent.
Wipe down shopping card (in sheet protector) before respondent shops
Do not have the respondent use the shopping cart or shopping basket.

block.html:
INTERVIEWER: PREPARE TO SHOW SHELF/SHOPPING LIST ACCORDING TO PHASE AS INDICATED BELOW:
[pipe: Shelf]

INTERVIEWER: HAND RESPONDENT SHOPPING CARD IN SHEET PROTECTOR.
Please go shopping for facial tissue products, assuming you are on a typical shopping trip.
When you see a product that you would like to purchase, please point to it and let me know how many you would like to purchase.
INTERVIEWER NOTES: DO NOT READ UNLESS ASKED!
Assume this is a single trip to the store, keeping your budget in mind
You can purchase as many or as few items as you would like
Assume this is a typical trip to the grocery store, not for a holiday or special occasion
Assume you have run out of these items at home

checkbox.label: P_PickUp_BackOfPack
checkbox.validate: for row in P_PickUp_BackOfPack.rows: if P_PickUp_BackOfPack.rows[row.index].c2 and not(P_PickUp_BackOfPack.rows[row.index].c1): error("RESPONDENTS MUST PICK UP A PRODUCT IN ORDER TO LOOK AT THE BACK PANEL.")
checkbox.row: GREAT VALUE ULTRA FACIAL TISSUE 4X120 FLAT
Puffs Ultra Soft Non-Lotion Facial Tissues, 4 Mega Cube Boxes, 72 tissues
Kleenex® Ultra Soft™ Upright 2 Pack Medium CT 60
KLNX RCH WHT WRP FCL TS 3 PLY 8PK 10 CT
GREAT VALUE ULTRA UPRIGHT 75 COUNT FACIAL TISSUE
GREAT VALUE LOTION 300 COUNT 4 PACK FACIAL TISSUE
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120
GREAT VALUE MAINLINE FACIAL TISSUE 4X160 FLAT
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120

number.label: P_QuantityPurchased
number.row: GREAT VALUE ULTRA FACIAL TISSUE 4X120 FLAT
Puffs Ultra Soft Non-Lotion Facial Tissues, 4 Mega Cube Boxes, 72 tissues
Kleenex® Ultra Soft™ Upright 2 Pack Medium CT 60
KLNX RCH WHT WRP FCL TS 3 PLY 8PK 10 CT
GREAT VALUE ULTRA UPRIGHT 75 COUNT FACIAL TISSUE
GREAT VALUE LOTION 300 COUNT 4 PACK FACIAL TISSUE
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120
GREAT VALUE MAINLINE FACIAL TISSUE 4X160 FLAT
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120

number.label: O_PurchaseDuration
number.comment: Enter one digit in each box (including zeros).
number.validate: if this.c1.ival+this.c2.ival+this.c3.ival+this.c4.ival+this.c5.ival==0: error("SHOPPING TIME MUST BE GREATER THAN 0 SECONDS")

float.label: ShopTimeSeconds
float.title: Shopping Time (Seconds)
float.exec: ShopTimeSeconds.val = O_PurchaseDuration.c1.ival*60 + O_PurchaseDuration.c2.ival*10.0 + O_PurchaseDuration.c3.ival*1.0 + O_PurchaseDuration.c4.ival/10.0 + O_PurchaseDuration.c5.ival/100.0

checkbox.label: P_PickUpTotal
checkbox.title: Picked Up

checkbox.label: P_BackPanelTotal
checkbox.title: Back Panel

checkbox.label: P_Shopping
checkbox.title: Products Bought

number.label: P_Total_Products
number.title: Total Products Purchased
number.exec: P_Total_Products.val = sum([int(r.val) for r in P_QuantityPurchased.rows if r.val])

row.label: TB
row.autofill: P_Shopping.r2 or P_Shopping.r6 or P_Shopping.r7 or P_Shopping.r8 or P_Shopping.r14 or P_Shopping.r15 or P_Shopping.r16 or P_Shopping.r20

div.ul:
WHEN RESPONDENT IS FINISHED, HIT THE "STOP" BUTTON TO STOP THE RECORDING PROCESS.
THEN HIT "DONE" AND "SAVE" TO ENSURE ALL IS SAVED.
REMOVE THE MET GLASSES.

html.label: TURN_AWAY
html.strong: INTERVIEWER: ONCE SHOPPING IS COMPLETE, PLEASE TURN RESPONDENT AWAY FROM SHELF.

html.label: Recall_TurnedAway1
html.strong: INTERVIEWER: ENSURE RESPONDENT IS TURNED AWAY FROM SHELF UNTIL OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED.

radio.label: Q_EaseOfShop
radio.title: How easy or difficult was it for you to find the product(s) you wanted to purchase during this shopping trip?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

radio.label: Q_NewDiff
radio.title: During your shopping trip, did you notice anything new or different?

textarea.label: Diff1
textarea.title: You mentioned that noticed something new or different. What was new or different to you? Do you like it? Why, why not?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Diff2
textarea.title: What are your thoughts on how the facial tissues are organized on the shelf? Do you like it? Why, why not?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

checkbox.label: Q_PurchaseDriver_Kleenex
checkbox.title:
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ and capture what the respondents mention into what options.
Please select from the following statements the reason(s) you decided to purchase Kleenex products during this shopping trip.
checkbox.row: The number of tissues in the package(s)
The number of tissue packages in the bundle
The type of tissue package that you need
Comes in a packaging design I like
Comes in a format (box, travel, pocket, etc.) I like
Has the type of tissues I like (lotion, anti-viral, etc,)

checkbox.label: Q_PurchaseBarrier_Kleenex
checkbox.title:
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ and capture what the respondents mention into what options.
Please select from the following statements the reason(s) you decided NOT to purchase Kleenex products during this shopping trip.
checkbox.row: I'm not familiar with this product/never tried
I didn't find the product I wanted
I didn't notice it on shelf
This is not the type of tissue product I like
The packaging does not come in a design I like
The number of tissues in the pack
Does not come in a format (box, travel, pocket, etc.) I like
Does not have the type of tissues I like (lotion, anti-viral, etc,)

checkbox.label: Q_OA_Aisle
checkbox.title:
INTERVIEWER: READ options.
What is your overall opinion of the aisle you just shopped?
checkbox.row: It was easy to understand where products were located
It was organized in a way that was easy to navigate
It was difficult to understand where products were located
It was organized in a way that was difficult to navigate

block.label: FindabilitySection
block.html:
Now I am going to show you the display of facial tissue products again. This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
I am going to count down and then I would like you to turn around, walk up to the display, and find [pipe: Finda].

b.ul:
Keep a safe distance of 6 ft. away from respondents at all times
For Live Shelf & Printed Shelf displays, instruct respondent to point at product – NO TOUCHING OF THE PRODUCT OR PRINT
For Digital Shelf displays, have respondents use stylus pen – NO TOUCHING OF THE SCREEN
For ShopperLab Studies, have respondents apply a post-it to the product. Discard all unused post-its that were handled by the respondent.
Wipe down hand card (in sheet protector) before handing to respondent.

html.label: Finda_NoShelf
html.strong: INTERVIEWER: DO NOT RE-SHOW THE SHELF UNTIL INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN READ AND RESPONDENT IS READY TO BEGIN!

text.label: FindTime
text.title:
INTERVIEWER: HAND RESPONDENT CARD [pipe: FindCard] .
Now I am going to show you the display of facial tissue products again. This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
I am going to count down and then I would like you to turn around, walk up to the display, and find [pipe: Finda], as shown on the card.
IF RESPONDENT UNDERSTANDS CONTINUE WITH THE STEPS BELOW:
INTERVIEWER: Ready? 3-2-1 GO
TAP "START" AS SHELF IS SHOWN
WHEN RESPONDENT FINDS THE SPECIFIC PRODUCT, TAP "STOP" AND CHECK WHICH PRODUCT THEY ARE POINTING TO
text.validate: if this.val == "": error("You must use the stopwatch to record the time.")

radio.label: F1
radio.title: INTERVIEWER: Please select the product which has been picked by the respondent in the findability exercise.
radio.row: GREAT VALUE ULTRA FACIAL TISSUE 4X120 FLAT
Puffs Ultra Soft Non-Lotion Facial Tissues, 4 Mega Cube Boxes, 72 tissues
Kleenex® Ultra Soft™ Upright 2 Pack Medium CT 60
KLNX RCH WHT WRP FCL TS 3 PLY 8PK 10 CT
GREAT VALUE ULTRA UPRIGHT 75 COUNT FACIAL TISSUE
GREAT VALUE LOTION 300 COUNT 4 PACK FACIAL TISSUE
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120
GREAT VALUE MAINLINE FACIAL TISSUE 4X160 FLAT
KLEENEX LOTION FACIAL TISSUE FLAT 2 PK 120

text.label: FindLetter
text.title: INTERVIEWER: ENTER THE LETTER AND NUMBER OF THE PRODUCT FOUND.

text.label: FindNumber
text.title: INTERVIEWER: ENTER THE LETTER AND NUMBER OF THE PRODUCT FOUND.

radio.label: FindProduct
radio.title: Product Found

radio.label: ConfirmFind
radio.title:
YOU HAVE ENTERED THAT THE RESPONDENT LOCATED
[pipe: Finda]
IS THAT WHAT YOU INTENDED TO ENTER?

p.b: This section is self-administered and must be completed by the respondent.

radio.label: EaseofFind
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

radio.label: vEaseOfFind
radio.title: Ease of Find - filtered by correctly located - collapsed
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

float.label: vFindTimeSeconds
float.title: Time in seconds - Filtered by Correctly located - collapsed

html.label: Finda_RemoveShelf
html.strong: INTERVIEWER: REMOVE SHELF FROM VIEW/ESCORT RESPONDENT TO THE NEXT STATION.

textarea.label: EaseofFind_OE
textarea.title: What specifically made it [pipe: EaseofFind]?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

checkbox.label: Q_Layout
checkbox.title: Looking at the facial tissues shelf, which of the following statements reflect your opinion of the layout?
checkbox.validate: if (Q_Layout.r1 and Q_Layout.r6): error("You can not select I do not like the layout and I like the layout at the same time, please check your answers.") if (Q_Layout.r8 and Q_Layout.r9): error("You can not select Is informative and Is confusing at the same time, please check your answers.")
checkbox.row: I do not like the layout
Makes me aware of new products
Is easy to find the products I need
Has a good variety of items

radio.label: Q_OccasionsHub
radio.title:
Do you recall seeing the Kleenex Hub (as pictured above) when shopping the facial tissue shelf?
[pipe: PACK_Occasions]

textarea.label: Q_OccasionsHub_OE1
textarea.title:
You mentioned that you noticed the Kleenex Hub (as pictured above) on the facial tissue shelf. What made the Kleenex Hub stand out to you? Do you like it? Why, why not?
[pipe: PACK_Occasions]
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and as thorough as possible.

textarea.label: Q_OccasionsHub_OE2
textarea.title:
You mentioned that you did NOT notice the Kleenex Hub (as pictured above) on the facial tissue shelf. What factors or aspects led you to overlook or miss the Kleenex Hub? Do you like it? Why, why not?
[pipe: PACK_Occasions]
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and as thorough as possible.

checkbox.label: Q_PurchaseFactors
checkbox.title:
The following question is regarding Kleenex on-the-go facial tissues and if there would be interest in purchasing 1-pack vs. 4-pack as there were only multi-packs available on our shelf.
Which of the following factors, if any, would influence your decision to purchase a 1-pack instead of the 4-pack?
checkbox.row: Comes in a pack count for me

block.label: IAT
block.builder:title: Immediate Association Test
block.html:
The Immediate Association Test Explained:
In the immediate association test we want to find out whether the designs quickly and intuitively convey key attributes within a competitive context. For this, respondents are shown the test product and two key competitors. For each statement or attribute, respondents are given 6 seconds (maximum) to choose which product / brand best applies to the statement.
block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair DO NOT need to be captured in the summary table - - 1 is unique and different from other brands is the FIRST data point captured here

checkbox.label: vIM1B
checkbox.title: Test IAT Summary Table
checkbox.virtual:
if IM1B_1.c1: vIM1B.r1.c1.val=1 if IM1B_1.c2: vIM1B.r1.c2.val=1 if IM1B_1.c3: vIM1B.r1.c3.val=1
if IM1B_2.c1: vIM1B.r2.c1.val=1 if IM1B_2.c2: vIM1B.r2.c2.val=1 if IM1B_2.c3: vIM1B.r2.c3.val=1
if IM1B_3.c1: vIM1B.r3.c1.val=1 if IM1B_3.c2: vIM1B.r3.c2.val=1 if IM1B_3.c3: vIM1B.r3.c3.val=1
if IM1B_4.c1: vIM1B.r4.c1.val=1 if IM1B_4.c2: vIM1B.r4.c2.val=1 if IM1B_4.c3: vIM1B.r4.c3.val=1
if IM1B_5.c1: vIM1B.r5.c1.val=1 if IM1B_5.c2: vIM1B.r5.c2.val=1 if IM1B_5.c3: vIM1B.r5.c3.val=1
if IM1B_6.c1: vIM1B.r6.c1.val=1 if IM1B_6.c2: vIM1B.r6.c2.val=1 if IM1B_6.c3: vIM1B.r6.c3.val=1
if IM1B_7.c1: vIM1B.r7.c1.val=1 if IM1B_7.c2: vIM1B.r7.c2.val=1 if IM1B_7.c3: vIM1B.r7.c3.val=1
if IM1B_8.c1: vIM1B.r8.c1.val=1 if IM1B_8.c2: vIM1B.r8.c2.val=1 if IM1B_8.c3: vIM1B.r8.c3.val=1
if IM1B_9.c1: vIM1B.r9.c1.val=1 if IM1B_9.c2: vIM1B.r9.c2.val=1 if IM1B_9.c3: vIM1B.r9.c3.val=1
if IM1B_10.c1: vIM1B.r10.c1.val=1 if IM1B_10.c2: vIM1B.r10.c2.val=1 if IM1B_10.c3: vIM1B.r10.c3.val=1
if IM1B_11.c1: vIM1B.r11.c1.val=1 if IM1B_11.c2: vIM1B.r11.c2.val=1 if IM1B_11.c3: vIM1B.r11.c3.val=1
if not(data.c1.any): vIM1B.r99.c1.val=1 if not(data.c2.any): vIM1B.r99.c2.val=1 if not(data.c3.any): vIM1B.r99.c3.val=1
checkbox.row: Is unique and different from other brands
Contains tissues that leave my skin clean
Contains tissues that are soft/gentle on skin
Provides the right number of tissues
Did not choose product for any statement

html.label: IM1
html.span:
You are now going to see another series of statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it's going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

block.label: b1a
block.builder:title: default loop block

radio.label: IM1B_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

block.note: Is Unique and different from other brands is a Plus standard statement and should always be in position 1

textarea.label: IM2_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: What specifically about the [pipe: Brand] made you say it was "[loopvar:statement]" than the others?

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair, and 1 is unique and different from other brands need to remain in IAT for all studies and not edited.

looprow.loopvar: Is unique and different from other brands
Contains tissues that leave my skin clean
Contains tissues that are soft/gentle on skin
Provides the right number of tissues

block.label: AttitudinalTest
block.builder:title: TestBrand Attitudinal
block.html:
For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the Kleenex packaging you see here.
[pipe: LINE]

checkbox.label: Q_PackAtt
checkbox.title: You will now see some words and phrases that could be used to describe the appearance of a product. Do you think the Kleenex packaging is…

radio.label: Q_Communication
radio.title: [pipe: PACK]
radio.comment: Based on what you see here, how much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this Kleenex product?
radio.row: Is made by a brand I can trust
Contains tissues that are soft/gentle on skin
Comes in packaging that would be durable
Come in packaging that would protect tissues
Has the number of tissues per pack I prefer

radio.label: Straightliner
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

radio.label: Q_PI
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy this Kleenex product, if it was available at a price of [pipe: Price]?

p.b: Please inform the interviewer that you have completed this section.

html.label: Class_Intro
html.b: Now just a few questions for classification purposes...

radio.label: Q_TisseFormat
radio.title: Which of the following Facial Tissue formats do you typically purchase?

radio.label: Q_OnTheGo
radio.title: Do you take facial tissues with you on the go?

checkbox.label: Q_OnTheGoType
checkbox.title: Which of the following format(s) of facial tissues do you typically take with you on-the-go?
checkbox.row: Tissues that in a plastic bag/small container

p.b:
Thank you for your participation in completing this survey.
Please inform the interviewer that you have finished.

p.strong:
THANK RESPONDENT FOR THEIR TIME AND COOPERATION.
NOTE TO INTERVIEWER: Click the "Continue" button.

html.label: Final

strong.strong: PLEASE VERIFY THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IS CORRECT. IF THIS INFORMATION IS NOT CORRECT PLEASE SEE YOUR SUPERVISOR BEFORE CLICKING "CONTINUE".

html.div:
Resp ID: [pipe: Resp]
Name: ${Resp_Info.Name}
Phase: [pipe: Phase]
Gender: [pipe: Gender]
Age: [pipe: Age]
Usage: [pipe: Usage]
BUMO: [pipe: BUMO]
Sample: [pipe: Sample]
MET (ATL Only): [pipe: MET_Complete_Qual]
